Dear School_C Admissions Team,

I’m Student_E, and I’m applying again because School_C remains my first choice. If offered admission at any point, I will accept immediately and withdraw from all other options.

Since we are now in round 13 and your seat is still unfilled, could you please let me know (even in general terms) what would need to happen for you to extend an offer to me—for example, whether you are waiting on specific higher-priority candidates to apply, and whether there is a round by which you expect to finalize the seat if they do not?

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for your thoughtful questions.

At this stage, we still need to keep our single remaining seat available for any higher-priority candidates on our list (Student_C, Student_B, and Student_D) should they apply in upcoming rounds. A realistic path for an offer to you would be that those higher-priority candidates either (a) match elsewhere, or (b) do not apply to School_C as we approach the end of the process.

Because that possibility is still open in round 13, we are not able to extend an offer to you this round. We also cannot commit to a specific “finalization” round in advance, but if we reach later rounds and it becomes clear that higher-priority candidates are no longer in play, we would revisit promptly.

We genuinely encourage you to continue pursuing your other preferred schools in parallel rather than waiting on School_C.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
